docs.lead_paragraph: Stephanie Nina Pitsirilos and Dr. Cyrus Amir Boquín were married on Tuesday by the Rev. Douglas D. Knight, an interfaith minister, at the Church Center for the United Nations in Manhattan. The couple met at the University of Michigan, from which the bride graduated and where the bridegroom received a master's degree in public health and his medical degree.
docs.snippet: Stephanie Nina Pitsirilos and Dr. Cyrus Amir Boquín were married on Tuesday by the Rev. Douglas D. Knight, an interfaith minister, at the Church Center for the United Nations in Manhattan.

byline.original: By SIERRA PRASADA MILLMAN and JAVAID KHAN

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students evaluate the health of breakfast foods. They work in pairs to create and solve word problems using cereal nutrition data. For homework, they solve additional problems formulated in class and write short essays commenting on what they have learned.
docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.

docs.abstract: Miscellaneous cuts proposed by Pres Bush's 2006 budget; overall limit of $250,000 on farm subsidies, down from $360,000; stricter eligibility rules for food stamps are expected to save $57 million in 2006; Medicaid cuts anticipate savings of $60 billion over 10 years and give states new power to reduce or reconfigure benefits; Department of Health and Human Service would get additional $304 million to build health clinics in poor neighborhoods for total of $2 billion (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Following are some other major programs facing budget changes in President Bush's budget: The budget sets an overall limit of $250,000 on subsidy payments to farmers growing a wide range of commodities like cotton, rice, corn, soybeans and wheat. The current limit is $360,000 a year but loopholes in the program have allowed subsidies that can exceed $1 million in some cases.
docs.snippet: Following are some other major programs facing budget changes in President Bush's budget:.
